Posted By: getz19 (4/15/2010 11:37:47 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Obviously this card isn't designed to be hard-casted...   
  
I tend to run a copy in every reanimation deck I build, just because it fits the theme so well. Only problem is that it's almost always better to directly reanimate the creature that'll lock my opponents down or kill them that turn instead of reanimated the Reya and waiting for her ability to resolve the next turn. [Blazing Archon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blazing Archon), [Iona, Shield of Emeria](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Iona, Shield of Emeria) and even [Voidstone Gargoyle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Voidstone Gargoyle) are all creatures I tend to pull out before this girly, even if she can pull them out a turn later herself. That turn is a doozy.   
  
I think the old art with the uplit radiant "O"-face and spread legs was a little bit hotter as well. Love the short hair. She seems more tranquilly afterglowing in this picture. Angels in miniskirts is such a nice thought.
posts.html:

Posted By: TheWrathofShane (12/28/2010 7:01:19 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@RedCarmine  
  
No, the kicker only takes effect when you pay the cost. You only have the opportunity to pay the cost when you cast the spell. If you have a way to cast it without paying its mana cost then you can pay the additional kicker cost and the kicker will take effect. If you just put a creature into play you're not casting it so you can't even pay the kicker cost.
posts.html:
@RedCarmine

No, the kicker only takes effect when you pay the cost. You only have the opportunity to pay the cost when you cast the spell. If you have a way to cast it without paying its mana cost then you can pay the additional kicker cost and the kicker will take effect. If you just put a creature into play you're not casting it so you can't even pay the kicker cost.

posts.post_content:
Rules question to everyone: If Reya brings back a creature with a kicker cost that was kicked before it went into the graveyard, does the kicker effect on that creature apply when it is put back on to the battlefield?  
  
Edit: @SwordofKaldra  
  
Thanks, the reason I ask is I was playing the Duels of the Planeswalkers game and Reya reanimated Kor Sanctifiers which I had countered earlier. They destroyed my Platinum Angel losing me the game, I wondered if I didn't fully understand kicker or it was just the game.

I worry about casting cost when looking at instants sorceries enchantments and artifacts.

Posted By: asskicker123456789 (9/11/2012 7:28:03 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: first off let me start by saying that i LOVE this card! i am a massive fan of legendaery angels and especially this one. However, poor old Reya is a little too expensive when compared to some cards these days. Lets take [Sheoldred, Whispering One](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sheoldred, Whispering One) for example. now Sheoldred has plus 2 power has an arguably better evasion AND makes our opponents sac a creature every turn as well as ressurecting one of ours. All this for 2 less manna! plus Sheoldred is a little bit more splashable in multicolored decks. Overall Reya is a little to expensive these days, however she has awesome artwork and very useful abitily especially in a mono white deck. overall a very good card. 4/5
posts.html:
